Line 113: Line 113:
===The Yes Camp ===
===The Yes Camp ===
â
The [[Muslim Brotherhood]] and the [[Salafi]] movement (including famous Salafi preachers {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Hassan|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ Ø­Ø³Ø§Ù}} and {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Abdel Maksoud|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§ÙÙÙØµÙØ¯}}<ref name="Religious propaganda, vote-buying flourish in Egypt ahead of vote">{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/362640 |title=Religious propaganda, vote-buying flourish in Egypt ahead of vote | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher= |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref>), among other Islamist groups in Egypt, think that the amendments are suitable for the time being and that the situation in Egypt is not suitable to write a new constitution right away. They have used fear tactics saying that '''Article 2''' of the Constitution of Egypt (which states that ''Islam is the Religion of the State. Arabic is its official language, and the principal source of legislation is Islamic Jurisprudence ([[Sharia]])''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.egypt.gov.eg/english/laws/constitution/chp_one/part_one.aspx |title=EgyptÃ¢â¬â¢s Government Services Portal - Egypt Constitution - Chapter one: The State |publisher=Egypt.gov.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref>) will be removed or changed if the proposed changes are not approved, even though ''constitutional amendment committee'' said that Article II will not be touched<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/324621 |title=Constitutional amendment committee: Article II will not be touched | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-02-20 |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref>. Sheikh [[Yusuf al-Qaradawi]] advised the Egyptians on the 18 of March to vote Yes on constitutional referendum.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=422881&version=1&template_id=36&parent_id=16 |title=Gulf Times â Qatarâs top-selling English daily newspaper - Qatar |publisher=Gulf-times.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref> The [[National Democratic Party (Egypt)|NDP]] also have asked their base to vote Yes<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/~/NewsContent/1/64/7971/Egypt/Politics-/Egyptian-Islamists,-along-with-NDP,-campaign-hard-.aspx |title=Egyptian Islamists, along with NDP, campaign hard for a "Yes" vote on Constitutional amendments - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref>.
+
The [[Muslim Brotherhood]] and the [[Salafi]] movement (including famous Salafi preachers {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Hassan|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ Ø­Ø³Ø§Ù}} and {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Abdel Maksoud|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ Ø¹Ø¨Ø¯ Ø§ÙÙÙØµÙØ¯}}<ref name="Religious propaganda, vote-buying flourish in Egypt ahead of vote">{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/362640 |title=Religious propaganda, vote-buying flourish in Egypt ahead of vote | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher= |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref>), among other Islamist groups in Egypt, think that the amendments are suitable for the time being and that the situation in Egypt is not suitable to write a new constitution right away. They have used fear tactics saying that '''Article 2''' of the Constitution of Egypt (which states that ''Islam is the Religion of the State. Arabic is its official language, and the principal source of legislation is Islamic Jurisprudence ([[Sharia]])''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.egypt.gov.eg/english/laws/constitution/chp_one/part_one.aspx |title=EgyptÃ¢â¬â¢s Government Services Portal - Egypt Constitution - Chapter one: The State |publisher=Egypt.gov.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref>) will be removed or changed if the proposed changes are not approved, even though ''constitutional amendment committee'' said that Article II will not be touched.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/324621 |title=Constitutional amendment committee: Article II will not be touched | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-02-20 |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref> Sheikh [[Yusuf al-Qaradawi]] advised the Egyptians on the 18 of March to vote Yes on constitutional referendum.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gulf-times.com/site/topics/article.asp?cu_no=2&item_no=422881&version=1&template_id=36&parent_id=16 |title=Gulf Times â Qatarâs top-selling English daily newspaper - Qatar |publisher=Gulf-times.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref> The [[National Democratic Party (Egypt)|NDP]] also have asked their base to vote Yes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/~/NewsContent/1/64/7971/Egypt/Politics-/Egyptian-Islamists,-along-with-NDP,-campaign-hard-.aspx |title=Egyptian Islamists, along with NDP, campaign hard for a "Yes" vote on Constitutional amendments - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-03-19}}</ref>
The Muslim Brotherhood and the NDP are also perceived to be in favour of a "yes" vote because early elections would benefit them the most, as they have already got a good organization established, while smaller and newly-founded parties would have little time to prepare for elections in the planned schedule.<ref name="autogenerated1"/>
The Muslim Brotherhood and the NDP are also perceived to be in favour of a "yes" vote because early elections would benefit them the most, as they have already got a good organization established, while smaller and newly-founded parties would have little time to prepare for elections in the planned schedule.<ref name="autogenerated1"/>

â
[[Mohamed ElBaradei]] was attacked by men throwing rocks at him as he tried to vote in [[Mokattam]]. He left without voting, and later voted elsewhere.<ref>http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/926F772C-9DC7-4181-B55A-2A48A50B39AD.htm</ref><ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/365228 ElBaradei, supporters attacked at polling station], ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]'', 19 March 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12793484 Large turnout for Egypt's constitutional referendum], ''[[BBC News]]'', 19 March 2011</ref><ref>http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gem9Kx0MIS57hXR6bplIhQAG11LA?docId=CNG.4ff2e782ea3c513ce60adb517b709f8e.6e1</ref>
+
[[Mohamed ElBaradei]] was attacked by men throwing rocks at him as he tried to vote in [[Mokattam]]. He left without voting, and later voted elsewhere.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/926F772C-9DC7-4181-B55A-2A48A50B39AD.htm |title=Ø§ÙØ£Ø®Ø¨Ø§Ø± - Ø¹Ø±Ø¨Ù - ÙØ¬ÙÙØ¹Ø© ØªÙÙØ¹ Ø§ÙØ¨Ø±Ø§Ø¯Ø¹Ù ÙÙ Ø§ÙØªØµÙÙØª |publisher=Aljazeera.net |date=2006-11-14 |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref><ref>[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/365228 ElBaradei, supporters attacked at polling station], ''[[Al-Masry Al-Youm]]'', 19 March 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12793484 Large turnout for Egypt's constitutional referendum], ''[[BBC News]]'', 19 March 2011</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Salem |first=Mona |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gem9Kx0MIS57hXR6bplIhQAG11LA?docId=CNG.4ff2e782ea3c513ce60adb517b709f8e.6e1 |title=AFP: Hundreds of Islamists stone Egypt's ElBaradei |publisher=Google.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref>
